question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee and Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 and not die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a NO resolution as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution. (b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden ceases to be the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the YES resolution for part (b). Otherwise, the question resolves NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No. Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus. Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will the USA both top the Olympic Medal Table and win as many or more Silver than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following occur:
(a) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team wins as many or more Silver medals than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table which orders countries by the number of Gold medals, then Silver medals, then Bronze medals. This question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves NO if neither condition is met.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There must be no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024? (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (b) Chris Christie is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals being the nominee:
 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who else is selected as the nominee, as long as it is not Chris Christie. This determination is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on the eventual candidate on the day of the election.

For the Trump family, this includes any of the following individuals being selected: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block is confirmed through the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (2) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(1) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Ireland fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee and Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this question is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be considered in the future, but both conditions must be simultaneously satisfied for a **Yes** resolution.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market. (Market link: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(b) The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT (chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, or will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), it will still resolve positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO if fewer than 377 traders are recorded by this deadline.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman (b) Joe Biden will not die before Saturday?
question.body:
This question resolves to “yes” if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
(b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

It resolves to “no” if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

If neither condition is met, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control. It resolves as No if the location is in any categories indicating Russian control, including assessed Russian advance, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Russia is assessed to have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, according to the ISW map criteria, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.

Details for (a): This part will resolve as Yes if, according to the ISW map accessed on June 1, 2024, the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine" or similar categories. It will resolve as No if the location is not under categories indicating Russian control.

Details for (b): This part will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. If no such statement is made by then, it will resolve as No.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

This resolves as Yes if fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

question.title: Will "Deadpool x Wolverine" have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie AND will Taylor Swift not cameo in the movie?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. (2) Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie "Deadpool x Wolverine" in any role, including voice roles. It will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB and there are no independent sources confirming her appearance.

question.title: Will either Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, or will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the "Deadpool and Wolverine" movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) as the record for the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The BoxOfficeMojo numbers are considered unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press, and the target number is over $284.5 million internationally for the weekend.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved presidential candidates, and (b) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, and (b) there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before May 1, 2024: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (b) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as an approved presidential candidate?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first component will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. The second component will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this component will resolve as No.

This combined question will resolve as Yes if both components resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, or (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, as reported by credible sources, or if there is disagreement, by an Ohio State source or statement? If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question regarding Ohio's 6th district is annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in this election, this part of the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution for the second part should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot for federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Biden cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

2. Joe Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) by resigning, dying, or otherwise leaving office. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not meet this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

The question resolves as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, 2024, this condition resolves NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will resolve as YES if there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified date.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EV imports, or (2) A group of 5 named Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
(1) The EU announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report that the EU has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and the names must be made public. In ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win and the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following are true according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It resolves **No** if either the Miami Heat is not crowned champion or the New York Knicks are crowned champion.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, previously held by Bill Johnson. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

2. Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is satisfied. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by credible sources, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify and Greece fail to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Lithuania does not qualify or Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points, as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself, and (b) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

The market resolves NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the resolution source is Kamala Harris' announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
question.body:
(a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This will occur if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in methodology will not affect resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP: This will occur if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify and Poland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Grand Final. If either Latvia does not qualify or Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Poland or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024 and Kamala Harris not become President or Acting President before July 26, 2024?
question.body: This resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution for this part. (b) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this is official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, or will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) Joe Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution for Biden remaining President.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals (b) The men's 100m dash winning time does not break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This market will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable, and (b) No athlete runs the Men's 100m race in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If either condition is not met, the market will resolve to "No". In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes" if the Men's 100m dash condition is also satisfied at that time.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 15 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either (a) any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the gold medals will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes". If neither of these events occur, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.

   - Melania Trump

2. Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this condition will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

The question resolves **No** if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by Friday or a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, there should be no unambiguous and conclusive statement made by Biden or his campaign that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

If either or both of these conditions are not met, this question resolves **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President (b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) A member of the Trump family, specifically Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.
