question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic Vice President. 

For Larry Elder, this is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). For Kamala Harris, the resolution is based on whether she is nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is not nominated, this part resolves to yes. If she is nominated, it resolves to no. The resolution for Kamala Harris can occur immediately after the nomination, and any changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee or Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and is not affected by any subsequent changes. (b) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not on who receives the nomination on the election day.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the same nation winning more than one women's team sport resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

(b) The question about a swimmer not winning the most gold medals resolves as Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) Czechia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; and (2) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Czechia or Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Georgia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) This resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will either Nvidia's market capitalization surpass Apple's on July 17, 2024, or will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's. This will be determined by comparing their market caps on Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This can be through signing a letter or another form such as collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. In ambiguous cases, if the names are not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the resolution will err towards NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this part will resolve as **No**.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. If someone else is selected as VP, this part will resolve as **No**. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal, and (b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first gold medal?
question.body:
(a) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.
(b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least 5 countries win either their first-ever Olympic gold medal or their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) France places in the Top 5 and (b) Sha'Carri Richardson fails to win a gold medal?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

(a) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively). The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) Sha’Carri Richardson does not win a gold medal in any event. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days:
- Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

- The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats and GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats, and (b) The GUE/NGL political group does not hold the most seats. If Greens–EFA is tied for the most seats, condition (a) is still satisfied. If GUE/NGL is tied for the most seats, condition (b) is not satisfied.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and Biden not drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (2) Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

The question resolves to NO if either Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate or if Joe Biden drops out before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the decision must be confirmed by Kamala herself before August 7th. For Joe Biden, he must remain in the race past July 20th midnight Eastern Time. 

Comment if you have any questions or news 💙

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, or (b) Kamala Harris picks Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP by August 7?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve to YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

(b) This part of the question will resolve to YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. It will resolve to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, and (2) there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves "No" if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention or (b) Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This resolves to YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it resolves to NO. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value is determined by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This will be resolved by checking the reported chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day. question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This part will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if there is such a debate.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. (2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, or (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question about the US Core CPI resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) The question about Biden resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold polls that close on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump when facing Joe Biden does not exceed that when facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden drops out before this time, the question will resolve as "No".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed from the primary ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question regarding Trump will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question about Trump does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection does not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will either Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains substantially the same even if rebranded.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Scotland does not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held does not have the consent of the London government. It will not resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style of referendum is held without UK government permission, or if a vote is organised by civil society institutions without official sanction.

This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** with respect to this condition if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution with respect to this condition, the absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: there should be no room for the possibility that Biden has announced he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if both conditions are satisfied as described above. If either condition resolves as **No**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location
The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) If Joe Biden drops out, no reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) A reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. This will resolve as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above and (2) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be less than or equal to that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
(1) This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

(2) This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is less than or equal to $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will either "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, or will "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013). The box office opening is verified by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1). (b) "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher. The market resolves NO if neither of these events occurs. If "Trap" does not have a reported CinemaScore, this resolves N/A for that part of the question.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as Yes if any other candidate is selected. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). This is not restricted to candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

If either condition is not met, this question will resolve to **No**. For the second condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is independent of who receives the nomination on the day of the election and is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will drop out if he drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met:

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The question resolves to No if neither of these conditions are met by their respective dates.
