question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: (a) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO otherwise. (b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team places anywhere other than gold at the Paris Olympics. 

It resolves **No** if either the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if neither condition is satisfied.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count towards the second condition.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 and fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (a) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) fewer than 24 world records are broken during the Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics or France place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true regarding OpenAI's commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle: - OpenAI publicly commits to the principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement must indicate a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) No definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be no unambiguous and conclusive statement that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. 

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the question resolves YES if the lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 15, 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) never closes below $100 per share before 7/31?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA does not close below $100 on any day before 7/31.

question.title: Will either Nvidia close sub $100 per share by 7/31 or US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before 7/31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify and Norway fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not qualify or Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Donald Trump Removal or Blockage:**
   - On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or blockage must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. **Russian Control of Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as "No" if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither of these conditions is met by their respective dates.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden will be ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is the same or lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This resolves as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed for July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the reported number by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. The question considers all candidates, including any new candidates added in the future.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following be true: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

2. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other with a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will not die before the end of Friday, July 26th?
question.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.
(b) There will be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is made before this time.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

This question resolves as Yes if either (a) or (b) resolves as Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
(a) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this part resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading. The value will be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both conditions must be satisfied for the overall question to resolve YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if either the New York Knicks do not win the Finals or the Orlando Magic win the Finals.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins and they are both eliminated from contention.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
(1) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For condition (b), a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden. The question will resolve as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Grand Final, and (b) Malta fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.body:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports during this period, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur before their respective dates according to official statements or credible reports: (a) Before August 1, 2024: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. (b) Before June 1, 2024: The same diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China as described. If any of these events occur before their respective dates, the question resolves as Yes; otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) No nation wins more than one women's team sport (b) No athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

(a) Women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means no single NOC wins more than one of these events.

(b) No athlete wins more than one medal for tennis.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
- association football
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.
