question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This is a combination of two questions:

1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? 
   - Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.
   - A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.
   - “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.
   - This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

2. Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
   - This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if either of these events occur.

(b) "Trap" (2024) will receive a CinemaScore of B or above. This resolves YES if "Trap" receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. "Trap" is directed by M. Night Shyamalan, with a great trailer. Recent CinemaScores for his films include: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (b) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals AND fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

question.title: Will either at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, or (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) Switzerland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Switzerland does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal does not qualify or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Switzerland or Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Switzerland or Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as Yes. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met:

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If either condition is satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, AND (b) Kalenjin athletes fail to win either the men's or the women's marathon race at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) either the winner of the men's marathon or the winner of the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, or (b) Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), or (b) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question resolves as **No** if neither event occurs.

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Boston Celtics not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following occur: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Boston Celtics are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No otherwise.

question.title: Will either the Boston Celtics or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Boston Celtics or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins and another team is crowned the champion.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote for Elon Musk's package and Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND does not advise against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) ISS advises against Musk's package or Kimbal's re-election OR (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If neither event occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? (b) Will Kamala Harris not be President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This is determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
(b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources do not report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (b) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce both dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
(a) USD/JPY exchange rate must be >= 145 at close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden must not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time. If no such announcement is made, the condition is satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the specified dates: (1) Joe Biden announces both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, or (2) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part.

(2) Resolves YES if the USD/JPY close is listed as >= 145 for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB 2 days after release AND will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be ≤ "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: Will both of the following occur: (a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) will be rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release. This resolves based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after release (August 6th), at noon PT. The precision used will be as listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal, and this is a strict inequality. (b) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" will be less than or equal to $185,548,391, which is the combined box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This will be determined using the box office data reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

question.title: Will either the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, or "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. (b) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title TBA) is rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release on August 6th, at noon PT. The rating will be based on the score displayed at that time, with precision as listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (2) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

2. Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President.

The duration of any incapacity does not matter for condition 2. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before mid-2024: (a) Biden declared incapacitated under 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following events occur before their respective deadlines:

(a) Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is "unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment, does not count.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:  
(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of delegates at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the election.  
(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ireland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Iceland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland does not qualify or Iceland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Iceland or Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Iceland or Ireland participates in their respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Iceland nor Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. Other candidates may be added in the future, but only Chris Christie being selected will resolve this part as **Yes**.

2. No definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The absence of such a statement must be clear and conclusive.

If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will resolve as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

2. Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. If he makes no such announcements, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024? (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these events occur, this question resolves NO.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early by July 21st, 2024? (b) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, arguing it stifles debate about his candidacy. A letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and obtained by POLITICO, signals that many Democrats remain unsettled about Biden’s candidacy. This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures would also suffice. If not, it resolves NO.

(b) This market resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with credible reporting as a secondary source.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following conditions are met: 
(a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, based on information such as that reported by Politico. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures are also sufficient.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman, and (b) Will Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question resolves as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. This will resolve as **No** if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro, and will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following occur: 
(a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. 
(b) In Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump against Joe Biden does not exceed that against a generic Democrat by 3% or more.

Details:
- Kamala's running mate choice will resolve YES if it is either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if it is anyone else.
- The Trump vote percentage difference will resolve YES if the difference is less than 3%, calculated as (Trump votes / (Trump + Democrat + Someone else)) in poll 1 minus the same formula in poll 2 being less than 0.03.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) Kamala Harris picks either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP?
question.body:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Kamala Harris picks either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP: The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment AND will Joe Biden not have any in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that this condition does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

(b) Joe Biden does not appear in any in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition is met. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition is not met. This condition does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be less than 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count as meeting the condition. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would count towards meeting the condition. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-July 2024: (a) Joe Biden has a 45+ minute in-person interview released, or (b) Donald Trump is removed from a primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

(b) Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.
