question.title: Will either Moldova or Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Moldova or Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Iceland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Iceland or Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither of these occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be considered less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will fail to have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

(b) Resolves YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses $284.5M or less globally in its opening weekend according to reports OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally this weekend.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie (2) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body: (1) Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. (2) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) France places in the Top 5 in the medal table (b) No nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met at the 2024 Olympics:

(a) France places in the top 5 in the medal table. This is determined by the total number of medals won by each country, ordered by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(b) No nation wins more than one women's team sport. This means that women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) must win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If the same NOC wins at least two of these events, this part resolves as No.

question.title: Will either the same nation win more than one women's team sport or France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means that at least one NOC must win gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

(b) France places in the Top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals won, with ties resolved positively. The ordering is based on the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of further ties.

The question resolves as **No** only if neither (a) nor (b) occurs. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the question involving France's placement will resolve ambiguously.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July AND will Democrats have an unbrokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part. (2) The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, this part resolves as NO. The entire question resolves as NO if either or both parts do not occur.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient, even if he has not formally resigned by the end of July. If neither condition is met, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state's primary election ballot for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, AND will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as "Yes". This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative or unofficial reports will not suffice. The question about Trump will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024, irrespective of any legal battles, appeals, or reversals occurring after that date.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) A terrorist attack occurs in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. (2) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (2) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) A terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) Joe Biden is still president of the United States (b) The US Core CPI increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The data for the CPI resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July (b) Joe Biden is still president?
question.body:
(a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. This resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. This resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at that time.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (b) The United States does not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

(b) Resolves Yes if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the United States Olympic Team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve No if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table (b) USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

(b) This will resolve Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ireland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Serbia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will either Serbia or Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, and (b) Joe Biden announces that he is either not dropping out or not resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces either that he is still running for re-election or that he will not be resigning and will complete his current term, or both. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. If no such announcement is made, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements are sufficient even if he does not formally resign by the end of July. (b) The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO if neither condition is met.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or above, and (b) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 is rated ≤8.5 on IMDB two days after release?
question.body:
(a) "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or above. This resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: "Trap" is the next film directed by M. Night Shyamalan.

(b) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) is rated ≤8.5 on IMDB two days after release. This resolves based on the score displayed two days after release, at noon PT. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres. The precision listed by IMDB is typically a single decimal, and this is a strict inequality.

question.title: Will either "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB or "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (title TBA) receives an IMDB rating greater than 8.5 two days after its release, based on the score displayed at noon PT on August 6th, using IMDB's precision (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality. The episode premieres and the market closes 90 minutes after. Current ratings for previous episodes are provided for context. (b) "Trap" (2024), the next film directed by M. Night Shyamalan, receives a CinemaScore of B or higher. The market resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower, and N/A if a CinemaScore is not reported. Context includes CinemaScores for some of Shyamalan's recent films.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the second condition will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the second condition will resolve immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, if either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals (b) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

If neither condition is met, the question will resolve to "No".

question.title: Will the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves Yes if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves No if any other team wins or if the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Dallas Mavericks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Minnesota Timberwolves not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Dallas Mavericks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Minnesota Timberwolves are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, meaning any other team wins or the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves as **No** if either the Dallas Mavericks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Minnesota Timberwolves or the Dallas Mavericks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves Yes if either the Minnesota Timberwolves or the Dallas Mavericks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves No if any other team wins or if both the Timberwolves and the Mavericks are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Latvia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Latvia or Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Latvia nor Georgia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024 (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Man?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

This question will resolve as “yes” if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

The first condition (a) will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election and “no” if/when they select a male nominee. 

The second condition (b) will resolve “yes” if the reported value on July 15, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by more than 2 and up to 3 points, and “no” otherwise. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (2) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(1) Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July and his past appearances on 60 Minutes have had less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Unnamed democrats writing to Biden will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and (b) Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is satisfied. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will either Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 and (b) there are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.
- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as NO. This question resolves the opposite of the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Will either diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, or will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes any of the following events: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolving NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 4 points. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The linked market will have at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The market will resolve YES if this condition is met and NO otherwise.

(b) OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that either OpenAI does not make a new public statement indicating a commitment to this principle, or Metaculus does not verify the company's acceptance of the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. If either of these conditions is true, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will either OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, or will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. **OpenAI Commitment**: Before July 1, 2024, both of the following must be true:
   - OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. **Market Traders**: The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th, 2023, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, 2023. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. A bullet-like projectile is defined as something that is for all intents and purposes a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, a BB gun pellet would not count as it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Did no one intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Resolves YES if no one intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if someone intentionally shot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either the men's pole vault or the men's 100m dash Olympic record be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The winning height of the men's pole vault is 6.04m or higher. (b) Any athlete runs the men's 100m dash in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If neither of these events occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the first condition, any candidate other than Tucker Carlson being selected will resolve as **No**. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For the second condition, a positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The specific range for Trump's lead must be either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 for this condition to be satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

2. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as No if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This will be determined if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine', 'Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours', 'Assessed Russian Control', 'Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine', or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

(b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. This will be determined if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs based on the criteria outlined above.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both men's and women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. (2) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. Resolves No if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, AND will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

1. **Regarding Manifold Polls and Trump:**
   - There are two Manifold polls, both closing on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other includes a generic Democrat.
   - The question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with the generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close.
   - The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.
   - Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

2. **Regarding Ron DeSantis and the Republican Nomination:**
   - This question resolves as YES if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The combined question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% more among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat.
(b) Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will either Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will either Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

If neither event occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) Fidesz-KDNP fails to maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU, and (b) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby failing to maintain the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will either Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, or will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if any of the following occur: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.
