question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is not higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the number reported by the St. Louis Fed on that date is greater than the number reported on July 20, 2023. This information will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(b) Donald Trump will be considered removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment if, on July 15, 2024, he has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution is strictly based on the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

If either of these criteria is met, the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th (b) Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) This resolves YES if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the election day.

question.title: Will either Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This can be through a signed letter or a group meeting with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Unnamed individuals or separate statements are insufficient unless qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguities will resolve towards NO.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Milwaukee Bucks win and the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/):

1. The Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals.
2. The Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals (either because they are eliminated from contention or another team wins).

It resolves as **No** if either the Milwaukee Bucks do not win the Finals or the Miami Heat wins the Finals.

question.title: Will either the Miami Heat or the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if either the Miami Heat or the Milwaukee Bucks is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if both the Miami Heat and the Milwaukee Bucks are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

"Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% and "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of C+ or lower?
question.body: This resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Tomatometer score of 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th), based on the Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will use the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes, typically an integer percentage, no decimal. For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. "Certified Fresh" is used for illustrative purposes, but the market resolves solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People"). (b) "Borderlands" (2024) receives a C+ CinemaScore or lower. This resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a C+ CinemaScore or lower, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or higher. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. "Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise. Here's a list of CinemaScores for previous video game adaptations.

Details for "Borderlands":
- The market resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.
- "Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.
- Here's a list of CinemaScores for previous video game adaptations.

Details for "Twisters":
- "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page
- This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th).
- I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).
- For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.
- "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this resolves NO. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

(b) No member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Resolves YES if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: Will either a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, or will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be released before the market closes at the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. For example, Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes, would qualify.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) There will be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention (b) Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be removed from a primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment or will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if neither of these conditions are met.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means Russian athletes are not competing under (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. For this condition to be met, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this condition resolves as ambiguously.

(b) Sha’Carri Richardson does not win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. This includes events from August 1 to August 11, specifically the Women's 100m and the Women's 4x100m Relay (if she competes). This will resolve based on the results of these events as reported by credible sources such as [NBC Olympics](https://www.nbcolympics.com/news/how-watch-shacarri-richardson-2024-paris-olympics).

The question will resolve as **No** if either of the above conditions is not met.

question.title: Will either Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games or Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days:

- Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as YES, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this question will resolve as NO.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO otherwise. The market can be accessed here: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(b) The question about Russia's control of Chasiv Yar will resolve YES if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any categories indicating Ukrainian control or lack of Russian control. It will resolve NO if the location is under categories indicating Russian control. Categories for Ukrainian control include:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories indicating Ukrainian control.
Categories for Russian control include:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or (b) the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location
The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Renew hold the most seats and ECR not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) Renew holds the most seats, and (b) ECR does not hold the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, Renew must be one of them and ECR must not be one of them, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either ECR or Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either ECR or Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If either group is tied for the most seats with another group, this question will also resolve as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. This takes into account the conditions specified in the individual questions for ECR and Renew.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Ukraine qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Australia fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ukraine does not qualify or Australia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Australia or Ukraine qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Australia nor Ukraine qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Poland qualify and Latvia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland does not qualify or Latvia qualifies for the Grand Final, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Latvia or Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, AND will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(2) This question will resolve as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources do not report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Dallas Mavericks win the 2024 NBA Finals and (b) The Orlando Magic do not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/):

(a) The Dallas Mavericks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals.
(b) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals.

It resolves as **No** if either the Dallas Mavericks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the Dallas Mavericks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the Dallas Mavericks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship and they are both eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election AND (b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

(b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024 (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before midnight July 20, 2024 Central Time, it is reported that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If this condition is not met, it will resolve to No.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district (previously held by Bill Johnson). If popular sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden both announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President and not die before Saturday, July 26, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

2. There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024.

If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before July 26, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee and will the Democratic nominee be a man for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

For the Republican nomination, it is not relevant who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the Democratic nomination, the resolution will be "yes" if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee and "no" if they select a female presidential nominee.

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

It will resolve as **No** if neither of these events occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) Someone other than Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Poland qualify and Czechia fail to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Czechia either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland does not qualify or Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify and Portugal fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Portugal or Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) none of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either a member of the Trump family or Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. (b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris becoming President: This will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, or a consensus of credible reporting.

(b) Trump gaining 3% against Biden: This will resolve to "Yes" if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The resolution is YES if the result from poll 1 minus poll 2 is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Will either of these scenarios occur?

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ukraine does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and will Ukraine fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control, including but not limited to:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

2. Ukraine does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This will occur if Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ukraine qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, or (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Ukraine will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 if Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ukraine does not qualify, the answer is **No**.

(b) Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any of the following categories:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The answer will be **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, including but not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, and (b) Nikki Haley is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This part will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This part resolves YES if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as YES. This part is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance: This resolves as **Yes** if a major media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides unofficial confirmation of Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours before he officially announces it. The market will resolve as N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, and (2) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft does not depart the ISS with astronauts by July 21, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

(2) The question resolves Yes if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft does not depart the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have not departed if it has not undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth by the deadline. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21, 2024 (b) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
(a) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel. This will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

(b) This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drop out before July 20, or (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to no. question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 DNC (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a YES resolution, no such unambiguous and conclusive statement should be made: there should be room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) There is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) Israel refrains from expanding its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) A terrorist act will be considered to have occurred in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. (b) Israel will be considered to have refrained from expanding its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024, if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024. This will be the case if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. This will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this will resolve as "Yes". This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

1. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither of these conditions is met.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html
If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Context from Politico:
Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 
If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(1) At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party must sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient. 

(2) 10 or more Democratic Senators must call for Biden to drop out before midnight July 20 Central Time, as reported by the New York Times. 

If either criterion (1) or (2) is met, the answer is YES. If neither is met, the answer is NO.
