question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the elections, and **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) Biden will cease to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves as **Yes** if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024. It resolves as **No** if he remains President through the end of July 2024. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) ID political group holds most seats after 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves YES if he remains President; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves YES if the ID political group holds the most seats. Resolves NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both resolve as YES. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (b) Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be less than 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before the end of July 2024: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, or (b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes: The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July 2024, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

(b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. 

(b) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? This resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

(b) Did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th? Resolves as Yes if an intentional shot was fired at Trump, excluding accidental discharge or ricochet. The projectile must be plausibly lethal like a bullet.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle remains the Director of the U.S. Secret Service through October 12, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not satisfied. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

(b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must remain in her position and not resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service within the next 90 days (b) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as the favorite over Donald Trump on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, as soon as the datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will refer to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The forecast refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark, and the number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) No group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressures Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This market resolves YES if no group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, or (2) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(2) Ron DeSantis must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Czechia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Lithuania does not qualify or Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Czechia or Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden will not be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Tim Scott will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden will not be president by the end of July 2024: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden remains president by the end of July 2024 (b) Tim Scott becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States. (b) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of each component is independent, and the question resolves as **Yes** if at least one component is satisfied.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur on July 15, 2024: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(2) Trump will not have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This will be confirmed by the absence of official announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such removal or block.

question.title: Will either of the following occur on July 15, 2024: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals and Real Madrid not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), and (b) Real Madrid does not win the Final of the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). 

It resolves as **No** if either the Boston Celtics do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or Real Madrid wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League.

question.title: Will either Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League or the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Real Madrid wins the UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/), or (b) the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves "No" if neither event occurs.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). 

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's? (b) Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block as of that date.

The question will resolve as **No** if either of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, (b) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
- Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
- Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
- Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count.

The question resolves as **No** if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or the ICC issue arrest warrants for Israeli leaders before July 2024?
question.body: This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution. (b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. It resolves NO if neither event occurs.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves YES. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be less than 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, or (b) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. 

(b) Ted Cruz must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) the Crimean Bridge is not hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has not been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; or (b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, and (b) the Venezuelan electoral commission fails to publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET, and (b) credible sources report that, by Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024? (b) Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if any of the following occur: (a) Credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). (b) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel qualify and Georgia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Georgia nor Israel qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. Resolution will be based on the source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this part will resolve to yes.

If both (a) and (b) occur, this combined question will resolve as **Yes**. If either (a) or (b) does not occur, this combined question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this resolves as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If GUE/NGL holds the most seats, this resolves as **No**. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolves as **No**. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or the Republicans Party of France form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, resolving as **Yes** if they do, or if tied for most seats, according to [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) An electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced before June 30, 2024, between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If neither of these events occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) San Marino qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Albania fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Albania either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the EBU as having failed to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Albania or San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if neither Albania nor San Marino qualify for the Grand Final.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 13?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals and will the USA win as many or fewer gold medals than silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If confirmed before the end of the Games, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (2) The United States Olympic Team wins as many or fewer Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves to "No".

question.title: Will either the USA win more Gold than Silver medals or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for part (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. If no such interview is released by the end of July 2024, this condition is not met.

(b) Mike Pence must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected as the nominee, this condition is met. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If neither of these events occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) This involves Iran initiating a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This action must be officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or confirmed by credible reporting and includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

(b) Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model must be <=46.6% on Friday, August 9th, 2024, at 8:40 PM for her odds not to increase. Otherwise, this condition is not met.

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

For the first condition, see the model at: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model.

For the second condition, a "military action" is defined as any use of force by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but not cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count, excluding attacks by proxy forces.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average (b) Biden will not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

1. Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

2. Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be ≤ 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: (a) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average if, on the chart for that date, Trump is reported to have a lead of ≤ 3 or > 4 points when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will resolve as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024 (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

(b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as Yes if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the absence of such a statement must mean that there is room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20 and will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

The question resolves to "No" if either or both of the conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden does not drop out or is not otherwise unable to continue the race before this time, this part of the question resolves to "No."

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.
