This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before August 1, 2024, none of the following events occur, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions):
   - The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If both conditions are met, this resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024 (b) Approval of the Pandemic Agreement at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
  - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
  - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
  - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
  - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(b) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

If neither occurs, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (2) FiveThirtyEight projects Donald Trump as the favorite over Joe Biden on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if and only if both of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used for resolution. The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this component will resolve 50-50. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark.

(b) Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question resolves to **Yes**. If neither occurs, it resolves to **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (b) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (2) An armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

2. An armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. This resolves as YES if credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties before June 6, 2024.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following occur: (1) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (2) Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this question requires that both conditions are met as described.

question.title: Will either Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For part (b), the resolution is based on whether a debate occurs between potential Democratic nominees before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. If such a debate occurs, this part resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from the 2024 Olympics and will Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For this part to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this part will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this part resolves as ambiguously.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, this part will resolve to "No". In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this part will resolve immediately to "Yes".

The overall question resolves as **Yes** only if both conditions are met. If either condition fails, the overall question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics or will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes". (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Man?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). 

For condition (b), the question will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election and “no” if/when they select a female presidential nominee.

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

The resolution criteria are as follows: 

- For part (a), the question will resolve as “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election and “no” if/when they select a male presidential nominee.

- For part (b), the question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This is determined solely by the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Nigel Farage is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

(b) In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is not elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if he is elected, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution should cite credible media reports from major UK news sources or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **No** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

The question will resolve as **No** if either (a) or (b) is not true.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to NO. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to YES. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP or (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) France places in the Top 5 and (b) No athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:

1. France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.
   - The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
     a. Number of Gold Medals
     b. (Where a is tied) Number of Silver Medals
     c. (Where b is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

2. No athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics. The medal table for part (b) is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024 (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions is met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either condition is met, the answer will be Yes.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden remains president by the end of July 2024, or (b) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, or (b) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For condition (b), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle remains the Director of the U.S. Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, and for no other reason continues to be the director of the Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024.

question.title: Will either the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days or Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024? (b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves Yes if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves No if any other team wins or if the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Minnesota Timberwolves not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, and the Minnesota Timberwolves do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Minnesota Timberwolves or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves Yes if either the Minnesota Timberwolves or the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves No if any other team wins, or if both the Timberwolves and the 76ers are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will both of the following occur by Friday: (a) Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite? (b) Kamala not president?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not satisfied. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this condition. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this condition will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this condition will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be President by July 26, 2024, or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting; (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, as indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date. If either condition is met, the resolution will be "Yes"; otherwise, it will be "No".

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024 (b) Biden not remaining President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

(b) Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?

Resolves YES if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

The combined question resolves as YES if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through end of July 2024 or diplomatic expulsions/recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution. (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, as per the resolution criteria of the Metaculus question. This includes any of the following events: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee or Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) There is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. If both conditions are met, the answer is **Yes**; otherwise, the answer is **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) Nikki Haley becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO if neither event occurs.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) No terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the Prime Minister of France will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) The question about terrorist acts will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early AND will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the answer is YES. If either condition is not met, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if any of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This happens if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **OpenAI Commitment**: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. **ChatGPT Availability in EU**: On June 30, 2024, ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN. If unavailable in certain EU countries or unavailable to certain demographics (e.g., minors), this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and the resolution remains positive if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the specified dates: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, or (b) OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. This resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

The question resolves as **NO** if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) is met by the specified dates.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024? (b) Google DeepMind publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) This resolves as **YES** if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves as **NO** if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The odds refer to the number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. (b) This resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?

The question resolves Yes if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals and the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves No if any other team wins, if the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention, or if the Miami Heat is crowned champion.

question.title: Will either the Miami Heat or the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if either the Miami Heat or the Minnesota Timberwolves is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if both the Miami Heat and the Minnesota Timberwolves are eliminated from contention.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals being the nominee:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Joe Biden does not announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be no definitive, public, official announcement from Joe Biden or his campaign that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is selected as VP, this resolves to NO. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP or Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, regardless of any subsequent changes, or (b) Joe Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). The market resolves NO if neither condition is met.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, AND (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body: (a) The USA wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This means the United States Olympic Team must win a higher number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at these games. (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that either the men's team or the women's team (or both) must place anywhere other than first (gold medal position) in their respective 5v5 basketball tournaments.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (2) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: (1) Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold. (2) Resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump will not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question requires both of the following to happen for a YES resolution:

1. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or by collectively speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats are not sufficient unless at least 5 names are made public. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO.

2. Donald Trump must not be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

If both conditions are met, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective communication. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately expressing this opinion is not sufficient. Unnamed individuals or ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO unless confirmed names are made public before the deadline.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Kamala Harris' VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro, and will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick: The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if she announces anyone else.

(2) Biden's Incapacity: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). Biden exiting by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Will both (1) Kamala Harris pick either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate, and (2) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 or (b) Kamala Harris announce her VP pick as Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Kamala Harris announce her VP pick as Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro: The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (b) There are no armed forces conflict deaths between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 
If there are no such reports before that date, then this condition is not met.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, there are no credible reports confirming any deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. If there are reports of such deaths, then this condition is not met.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

(a) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to no. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination. This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Evghenia Guțul travels to the Russian Federation between April 24, 2024, and June 1, 2024, and (b) the Crimean Bridge is not hit with an attack between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
