question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Biden both drop out before 7/13 and leave the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) Will Biden drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, resulting in a YES resolution? (2) Will Biden resign, die, or otherwise cease to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET), resulting in a YES resolution? Both conditions must be met for a YES resolution. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution for the second condition.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024 (b) Biden drops out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time; resolves YES if this happens. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, and (b) the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 does not break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means that no more than 34 Russian athletes can compete at the 2024 Olympics under any flag, including the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports indicating that the Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, or if the Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this condition resolves as **No** or ambiguously, respectively.

(b) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 does not break the Olympic record of 9.63s. This condition resolves as **Yes** if no athlete runs the Men's 100M race in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If an athlete does break the record, this condition resolves as **No**.

The overall question resolves as **Yes** only if both (a) and (b) are true.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, or (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Any athlete runs the Men's 100m race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes competing. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without significant Russian participation.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

If either Lithuania does not qualify or Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Luxembourg or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be neither Kelly nor Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The absence of such a statement must be clear: there should be no definitive, unambiguous, and conclusive announcement that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as Yes.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Joe Biden is no longer president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part will resolve as **No**.
(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States. If he is still officially president at that time, this part will resolve as **No**.

If either Latvia does not qualify or Cyprus qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Cyprus or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Cyprus or Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Cyprus nor Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee and Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives or does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected and who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Donald Trump or Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body: (a) This component will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) This component will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (2) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) No terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? (b) The Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. The question will resolve as No if neither of the above occurs.

This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel refrain from expanding its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will Israel refrain from expanding its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024: This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (2) Joe Biden is not president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (2) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(1) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. The market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(2) Joe Biden does not appear in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition is met. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition is not met. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

The question resolves to NO if either condition (1) or condition (2) is not met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (b) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(b) Joe Biden must have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Boston Celtics not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Boston Celtics are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as No if either the Los Angeles Clippers do not win or the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Boston Celtics or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Boston Celtics or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024 and will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This resolves YES if both of the following occur: (1) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (2) Before June 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, or will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and Ireland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. (2) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 or Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If neither occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

[image]

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

(b) Resolves YES if Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Will either Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Iran will not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If neither event occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, and (b) Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. The relevant selection is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Iran will be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Israel if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce not accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will Tadej Pogačar not win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Tadej Pogačar not win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on whether Tadej Pogačar is not officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this question will resolve as No. Additional details can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) The Boston Celtics not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) resolves as **Yes** if the reported number for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) The question about the Boston Celtics resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

(b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak will be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If for any reason Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will either Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election or Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, or (b) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Details for resolution:
- For Rishi Sunak: This resolves as **Yes** if for any reason he fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate will be used for resolution.
- For Francis Suarez: This resolves as **Yes** if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024, and (b) either Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part resolves 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard must be officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024 (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). The question resolves to 'Yes' if someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard is the winner.

(b) This part will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It resolves to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. The market resolves according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran, or (b) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming?
question.body: (a) Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals between the publication date of this question and May 1, 2024. (b) Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if, by June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both diplomatic expulsions/recalls between the Philippines and China occur before August 1, 2024, and no reliable media cover Joe Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, as defined by Metaculus resolution criteria, and (b) If Joe Biden drops out, no reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?

For part (a), this resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these events happens according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

For part (b), this resolves as Yes if Joe Biden drops out and no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his official announcement. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either a major media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance or diplomatic expulsions/recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) A major and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides unofficial confirmation of President Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold are not sufficient. This part of the question will resolve as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes any of the following events:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.
   This part of the question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus and will resolve as NO if there are no such reports before that date.

If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question resolves as YES.

Details for each component:

It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention, unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement.

(b) The question about "House of the Dragon" will resolve YES if "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 7 (title TBA) is rated 8.5 or lower on IMDB two days after its release (July 30th), at noon PT. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres. The precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal) will be used, and this is a strict inequality.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release? (b) Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body:
(a) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) will be rated >8.5 on IMDB two days after its release, based on the score displayed at noon PT. The resolution is based on the precision listed by IMDB, and it is a strict inequality. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres.

(b) Disney will announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World in Florida at or before D23 2024. The resolution will be YES if such an announcement is made by the end of the convention. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade is moving to Florida. The market closes August 8 and resolves at the end of the convention (unless announced prior).

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) S&D not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D does not hold the most seats, and as **No** if they do, or if two groups are tied for the most seats.
