question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) INC not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. If any other party has a member sworn in, it will resolve as **Yes**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will either the INC form the government after the next Indian general election, or will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024). (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (2) Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(2) The second part will resolve as **Yes** if Joe Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this part resolves NO. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, OR (2) Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Regarding Joe Biden's interview: The question will resolve as YES if Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no such interview is released by the end of July 2024, this part resolves NO.

(2) Regarding Scotland's referendum: The question will resolve as YES if Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. The referendum may be advisory and does not need to be legally binding, but it must have the consent of the London government and not be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum. If no such referendum is held by May 3, 2024, this part resolves NO.

This combined question resolves as YES if either of the above conditions is met.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be less than or equal to 76k or greater than 77k?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is less than or equal to 76,000 or greater than 77,000.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. (b) Credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

2. Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) No Iranian military response before August 13, 2024, midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(b) Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks by proxy forces will not count.

If both conditions are met, this resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory by August 12, 2024, or will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China by August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks will not count.

(b) Before August 1, 2024, any of the following diplomatic actions occur between the Philippines and China: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the PRC, recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. This must be according to official statements or credible reports.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs within their respective time frames, this question will resolve to "No."

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>
</iframe>

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A Slovak journalist or opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, and (2) Israel not expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will be satisfied if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, or if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect, before June 15, 2024.

(2) The second condition will be satisfied if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. The specific locations are shown in the map embedded in the original question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective dates: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah (b) A journalist or an opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico?
question.body:
(a) The question regarding Israel will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>
</iframe>

(b) The question regarding the Slovak PM will resolve **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt before June 15, 2024. Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
(a) Russian athletes will be considered barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics if they are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, they are not considered barred. If the Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this part resolves ambiguously.

(b) The Pandemic Agreement will be considered not approved if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the agreement is not approved in a vote, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, or (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) The Pandemic Agreement is approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) ECR not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** if ECR holds the most seats, including any ties for the most seats. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, resolving on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports, or (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, and (2) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will consult CNN's official transcript if necessary, but in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this condition resolves as **No**.

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 or will "deepfake" be said in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This happens if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says the word "deepfake." The determination of whether the word "deepfake" has been uttered will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

(2) Will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (b) the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US does not occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?

(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election; (b) USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

(b) This question will resolve positively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the United States Olympic Team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This combined question will resolve as YES if either of the following two conditions is met:

(a) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold, then Silver, then Bronze medals won. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

(b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in 2024. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. The question is annulled if no election is held before January 1, 2025.

The question will resolve as NO only if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) is met.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024 according to [FRED](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL), using the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will either the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024 or Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Details of the trial can be found at https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures or kills at least one person other than the terrorist(s), and (b) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is not broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will resolve as Yes if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, no men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does happen, this question resolves as No.

question.title: Will either the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics or a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

1. At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

2. A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question resolves as **No** if neither of the above events occurs.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. (b) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has not been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, and (b) Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to no if he isn't there. More details at https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

(b) Resolves to yes if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? More details at @/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul and @/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) Mayor Wilson shows at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6, asking respondents to vote with Joe Biden or a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + Democrat + Someone else)), and the answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Mayor Wilson shows at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024: Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, or dials in on Zoom with confirmation (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves NO if he isn't there.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, (b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or lower?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or lower, and it resolves NO if it receives a B or higher. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. "Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer). Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C. You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or above (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) will receive a CinemaScore of B or above if it gets a B CinemaScore or higher. It resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A. "Trap" is directed by M. Night Shyamalan, with previous CinemaScores for his films being "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

(b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents if the percentage of votes for Trump in a poll with Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat + Someone else)). The difference between poll 1 and poll 2 must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution. The polls will never resolve N/A and will remain open until the close time.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the ID political group will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) The ID political group will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** if the ID political group holds the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this part will resolve as **Yes**. (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on the election day. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question resolves as Yes if either of the two following conditions is met: (a) The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. The nominee is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by the outcome of the 2024 US election itself.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) No diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is independent of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **No diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024.** This means that none of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If both conditions are satisfied, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, or Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

2. Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris AND will Sha'Carri Richardson fail to win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if BOTH of the following occur: (1) Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race, which starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and resolves after the race. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this part resolves 50%/50%. (2) Sha’Carri Richardson does not win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days: Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9.

question.title: Will either Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games or Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Sha’Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events for her are scheduled from August 1 to August 11, with specific events on Women's 100m on August 2-3 and Women's 4x100m Relay on August 8-9. (b) Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. The race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and resolves based on their rankings, with considerations if they do not finish or start.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro, or (b) Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if anyone else is picked.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) The US government does not end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (2) The US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, or (2) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

(2) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
